summary: Email correspondence regarding the criminal case US v. Noel (19 Cr. 830), involving a sealed request submitted by defense attorney Andrew Patel to Judge Analisa Torres. The email chain includes a law clerk transmitting an order resolving the request and a confidentiality notice.

persons.name: Analisa Torres
persons.context: Judge Torres issued an order resolving a sealed request in the case US v. Noel.

persons.name: Andrew Patel
persons.context: Attorney Andrew G. Patel submitted a sealed, ex parte motion in the case US v. Noel on behalf of the defense.

connections.description: Andrew Patel submitted a sealed motion to Judge Analisa Torres's court for resolution.

events.title: Sealed Motion Submission
events.description: Defense attorney Andrew Patel submitted a sealed, ex parte request to the court in the case US v. Noel.

events.title: Order Issued
events.description: Judge Analisa Torres issued an order resolving the sealed request submitted by the defense.

events.title: Order Transmission
events.description: A law clerk transmitted Judge Torres's order and an unredacted copy via email.

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York 10007
80 Broad Street, Suite 1900, New York, NY 10004
keyFacts: The document pertains to the criminal case US v. Noel (docket 19 Cr. 830), presided over by Judge Analisa Torres.
Defense attorney Andrew G. Patel submitted a sealed, ex parte motion to the court on December 26, 2019.
Judge Torres issued an order resolving the sealed request, which was transmitted by a law clerk on January 10, 2020.
The email includes a confidentiality notice stating the communication is legally privileged under the Electronic Communications Privacy Act.
The prosecution team was noted to be out of the district until December 30, 2019, at the time of the motion's submission.
